snippet: Alderson, the team’s general manager, learned he had cancer after the Mets clinched the N.L. East and considered the team’s playoff run a nice distraction.
abstract: New York Mets general manager Sandy Alderson, who was told only days after team clinched National League East in September 2015 that he had cancer, meets with news media as spring training arrives; continuing to divulge little about his condition, Alderson assures reporters that he is ready to be part of Mets' aim at winning season.
lead_paragraph: Alderson, the team’s general manager, learned he had cancer after the Mets clinched the N.L. East and considered the team’s playoff run a nice distraction.

headline.main: Sandy Alderson, Feeling Better, Is Focused on Health of Pitchers and Wright
headline.print_headline: Alderson, Feeling Better, Is Focused on Health of Pitchers and Wright
